intro: Cyclophorus brevipes, commonly known as the short-footed cyclophorus, is a small, herbaceous plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant typically grows to a height of about 20-30 centimeters, featuring slender stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, arranged in umbels, and it blooms during the spring and early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
